definition: to feel ashamed of one's inferiority (idiom)/to feel inferior

sentences.english: Despising herself for being so ugly, my mother would leave herself alone.
sentences.chinese: 因为丑，自惭形秽的母亲一向都是孤独和寂寞的。

sentences.english: She can't hold a candle To the beauty of your smile.
sentences.chinese: 在你灿烂的笑容前，她只能自惭形秽。

sentences.english: They don't make us feel so good about ourselves. Right?
Well, this week I had an experience that humbled me.
sentences.chinese: 但是，这个星期的一段经历使我自惭形秽。

sentences.english: Even that I feel cheap to say that it was people.
sentences.chinese: 即使说那说那是人让我感到自惭形秽。

sentences.english: A benevolent man should allow a few faults in himself, to keep his friends in countenance.
sentences.chinese: 慈爱的人应给自己保留一些缺点，以免朋友自惭形秽。

sentences.english: Adults are humbled by the unselfishness of this little girl.
sentences.chinese: 成年人在这个小姑娘的无私面前自惭形秽。

sentences.english: Of course I had a sense of inferiority.

definition: ashamed and unable to show one's face
to feel ashamed at being inferior (idiom)
ashamed of being inferior (idiom)/to feel inferior to others
to lose one's splendor/to lose luster/to be eclipsed/to be overshadowed
to be jealous of (sb's achievements etc)/to be envious/envy
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
